<@U1JQYH133|lachlanm> has joined the channel
Hi
I am doing this Intro to Java course on Udacity
In the exercice, I get an error at a certain line in the code, illegal start of expression
Do you guys know what’s wrong?

Also my other question is, in this kind of scenario, when you know what line is the problem but you can’t seem to figure out what’s wrong, what’s your reflex to check what’s the problem? Here for example it says that the line public void OccurrencesOf(String word); is the problem, so it’s a method declaration problem, but how do I check what’s wrong with it?
`public void OccurrencesOf(String word);` should not end with a semicolon
normally you should have a more explicit error than "this line is the problem", a good habit is to fully read the error messages, it generally helps to find out the error.
The Udacity IDE doesn’t give me more actually
I try with this

And get this as error:

Compiler error:

/tmp/codecheck.x6QAHoK2Ks/LookUpAnyWord.java:24: error: illegal start of expression
        public void OccurrencesOf(String word)
        ^
/tmp/codecheck.x6QAHoK2Ks/LookUpAnyWord.java:24: error: illegal start of expression
        public void OccurrencesOf(String word)
               ^
/tmp/codecheck.x6QAHoK2Ks/LookUpAnyWord.java:24: error: ';' expected
        public void OccurrencesOf(String word)
                                 ^
/tmp/codecheck.x6QAHoK2Ks/LookUpAnyWord.java:24: error: ';' expected
        public void OccurrencesOf(String word)
                                             ^
4 errors
Line 24 is the public void etc...
ok, you try to define a function inside another function ?
when I wanted to test small thing I used this online interpreter
<http://www.tutorialspoint.com/compile_java_online.php>

attachments.title: Compile and Execute Java Online
attachments.text: Compile and Execute Java Online - Try and experience the best cloud computing where you can edit, compile, execute and share your varities of projects with the help of simple clicks. You can save your projects at Dropbox, GitHub, GoogleDrive and OneDrive to be accessed anywhere and any time. We support almost all the popular programming languages including Java, JSP, Cold Fusion, C, C++, Hadoop, PL/SQL, SQL, NumPy, SymPy, Octave, CentOS, iPython, Pascal, Fortran, PHP, Perl, Ruby, Python and many more other programming languages using your browsers, iPhones, iPads or any other online device like smart TV.

Ok so I should just put it outside
yep
but still in your class

Ok so I think I might have solved it but weirdly now I get an error “earlier” in the code:         Scanner userInput = new Scanner.next();
        String word = userInput;
Says cannot find symbol on Scanner userInput = new Scanner.next();
Isn’t .next() what you use to read a string as a user input?
Use `new Scanner()`
and then user `next()` on the scanner
<@U055JANKU>: isn’t that what I’m doing?
but if it cannot find the symbol, you probably first need to import the class
Oh
import statement?
import java.util.Scanner?
<@U06QL7UHK>: no, compared to what you typed: `new Scanner.next();`. (The `nextLine()` is used to read the input until an enter occurs)
yes `import java.util.Scanner;`
Ok that solved one error
see, errors were quite explicit
<@U1H4F3ZCH>: hmmm I wouldn’t say that hahaha
in fact, with practice, you'll see that's actually the case :wink:
it cannot fix the error for you, you know

no suitable constructor found for Scanner()
        Scanner userInput = new Scanner();
Looks like the compiler isn’t happy with the first line you suggested <@U055JANKU>
then another good habit: read the doc :stuck_out_tongue: <https://developer.android.com/reference/java/util/Scanner.html>
you'll see that the constructor expects an argument
But I don’t understand what that document says hahaha
I’ve tried reading it already and in each sentence they use words that are super cryptic to me hahaha
Normally since it’s the exercice on Udacity I should be able to do without it
what do you want to read, ? Standard input ?
Whatever string the user will put in the console
then it is `new Scanner(<http://System.in|System.in>);`
Solved it
Ok next error I’m trying to figure out on my own
be careful about the return type
`next()` returns an integer
You say when it says cannot find symbol it means I’m missing an import statement right?
`new Scanner(...)` a Scanner
so your mistake was trying to store in a Scanner the integer returned by next
yes, it's more probably that
or that you are mispelling the name
I’m literally laughing at my own noobiness trying to write very simple code and generating a HUGE amount of errors :joy::joy::joy:
Behold, the most catastrophic dev you’ll ever meet
all the devs have been big noobies at the beginning :wink:
int length = alice.length(); says cannot find symbol
length returns an integer, and there aren’t a thousand ways of writing alice either, don’t know what’s wrong
`alice` is an object of class `Book`. What methods this class does provide ? Maybe, it has no method called `length`.
HHmmm
Not sure I know what you’re asking
I wouldn't worry about it <@U06QL7UHK> - we were all noobs once. I've certainly, in the past generated a huge amount of errors on a small piece of code :smile:
Looks like class Book does not have a method called length()
but length is provided by java.lang.string
I tried importing it, but it didn’t solve the problem
that's for `String` objects, not `Book`
`Book alice = new Book("aliceInWonderland.txt");`, alice is a Book
they should have given you the methods in Book, for example a method to retrieve the content of book in a string
we cannot tell you that, we do not know the Book class
But that’s the job of Scanner
Oh I think it does that already
They say not to worry about it
Normally the book class should return a string
in Java, there is a method that most of the class implements, it is the `toString` method
but I'm just supposing that they did it like that
maybe try: `String alice = new Book("aliceInWonderland.txt").toString();`
Seems to have solved the problem
and prints that out to see if it is the expected behaviour: `System.out.println(alice);`
Now what I wonder is, how the hell am I supposed to come up with that by myself?? :joy:
I have no idea what you just changed nor why, all I know is it works lol
That’s so dumb
seems that's a bad course
or you missed a line from the explanation :stuck_out_tongue:
Urf, how the fuck do you not expect people to just drop xD
I want to drop so bad right now
I'm curious - which course are you taking <@U06QL7UHK> ?
Jesus the motivation I need to pull out of my gutt to keep going hahaha
